questions.question: 1. Which step in a Genetic Algorithm ensures genetic diversity and prevents premature convergence ?
2. The major advantage of using Genetic Algorithms for gene expression analysis compared to traditional clustering methods ?

answers.a: GAs strictly follow a fixed set of clustering rules
answers.b: GAs explore a broader search space and dynamically optimize clustering criteria
answers.c: GAs require no computational power to execute
answers.d: GAs always produce the same clustering results in every run

questions.question: 3. How does a fitness function contribute to gene clustering in Genetic Algorithms (GAs) ?

answers.a: It randomly assigns genes to clusters
answers.b: It evaluates the quality of clustering solutions by optimizing intra-group similarity and inter-group distinctiveness
answers.c: It eliminates genes with low expression levels
answers.d: It selects genes based on their DNA sequence

questions.question: 4. In the context of gene expression analysis, what does the crossover process in GAs achieve ?

answers.a: RiboIt combines genetic material from two parent solutions to create a new solutionsome
answers.b: ChromoIt eliminates genes with low expression valuessome
answers.c: MitocIt replaces existing solutions with randomly generated oneshondria

questions.question: 5. Genetic Algorithms can be applied in biomedical research for

answers.a: Predicting disease risk based on genetic mutations
answers.b: Designing synthetic DNA sequences for gene editing
answers.c: Automating laboratory experiments without human input
